title: Rclone mounting fails when done by pam_mount

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I want to use pam_mount to automatically mount a Proton Drive directory using Rclone, decrypting the Rclone configuration file using my login password. An error occurs when attempting to do this.

```
sddm-helper[1436]: (mount.c:68): Messages from underlying mount program:
sddm[1436]: (mount.c:68): Messages from underlying mount program:
sddm[1436]: (mount.c:72): Enter configuration password:
sddm[1436]: (mount.c:72): password:2025/03/29 14:46:36 CRITICAL: Failed to read line: EOF
sddm-helper[1436]: (mount.c:72): Enter configuration password:
sddm-helper[1436]: (mount.c:72): password:2025/03/29 14:46:36 CRITICAL: Failed to read line: EOF
sddm-helper[1436]: (pam_mount.c:522): mount of Proton:/Sync failed
sddm[1436]: (pam_mount.c:522): mount of Proton:/Sync failed
```

Rclone's behavior is to throw an error whenever it encounters and EOF in stdin, even if a password was entered.

```
// fs/config/ui.go
line, err := buf.ReadString('\n')
if err != nil {
	fs.Fatalf(nil, "Failed to read line: %v", err)
}
```

I have found and tested a fix that would ignore EOFs if the read string is not empty, and will submit a PR shortly.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.69.1
- os/version: arch (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.13.8-arch1-1 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.24.0
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Arch Linux x86_64

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Proton Drive

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

I assume under-the-hood this would be `mount.rclone Proton:/Sync /home/samantha/Mounts/Proton/Sync -o config=/home/samantha/.config/rclone/rclone.conf,vfs_cache_mode=writes`.
